results.title: What's new in solid waste management
results.brief_description: Describes a number of research and demonstration projects contributing to solid waste management technology in the United States. It is intended to provide useful data for the comparative analysis of these emerging new systems without the necessity of making expensive field trips. Though semi-technical and specifically intended for public officials who authorize and fund solid waste collections and disposal operations, the film is also understandable to non-technicians.

results.title: What's it all about, Harry?
results.brief_description: Harry and young Greg go shopping. As they shop Greg asks Harry how many bells does he give for help advice and service at each business. Harry is a telephone technician and he explains the problems dealing with various customers.

results.title: What's in a shadow?: Finding directions
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the measurement of shadows throughout the day to determine the sun’s position and how to use this knowledge to find one’s direction. Also defines the earth’s relationship to the sun.

results.title: What's in a sandpit?
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: No 2 in a series of in-service science education films produced for the Curriculum and research Branch for discussion purposes. This film is to be used to introduce the new Primary Science course. A group of teachers discuss how they might plan work for their pupils. Various problems are discussed. From the “Science in Primary School” series.

results.title: What's in a rainbow?: making scientific models
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
Shows how to create a scientific model of a rainbow using a hose, stressing that the angle of the sun in the sky is an important factor in determining whether or not a rainbow appears. Introduces the ideas of reflection and refraction. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: What's causing the problem? (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The second step in performance appraisal is the need to identify and agree on the cause of the work problem before discussing solutions. Examples of no agreement on cause are followed by Peter Quarry demonstrating clear agreement on cause.

results.title: What's agro-forestry?
results.creator_credit: Roger Seccombe, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Agro-forestry is a combination of growing pine trees for timber production and pasture for livestock production to gain maximum use of fertilisers and soil nutrients. Various forestry officers and farmers give their opinions on advantages and disadvantages of the scheme.
results.description: Agro-forestry is a combination of growing pine trees for timber production and pasture for livestock production to gain maximum use of fertilisers and soil nutrients. Various forestry officers and farmers give their opinions on advantages and disadvantages of the scheme.

results.title: Whaling
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Pathé Frères
results.brief_description: An account of a modern whaling fleet at work; departure of the whale catcher from the Saldanha bay Whaling Station in South Africa; preparations for the hunt; a whale is sighted; aiming and firing the harpoon gun; harpooning the whale; return to the whaling station; treatment of the whale; rendering of meat and blubber.
